publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1104# Sarah Boyack: Congratulations to the University of Edinburgh for Use of Renewable Energy-That the Parliament congratulates the University of Edinburgh for its progressive use of Combined Heat and Power (CHP) and photovoltaics as part of the university's energy strategy; welcomes the university's success in winning a grant from the UK Government's Major Photovoltaics (PV) Demonstration Programme; acknowledges the work of former student Andrea Connelly who undertook a feasibility study and established that the College of Science and Engineering campus at King Buildings would be suitable for CHP; understands that the project will cut the university's annual estates costs and free up scarce budgetary resources for other priorities such as fire safety and disabled access; applauds the university for commissioning another CHP system at Pollock Halls of Residence and George Square which will cut carbon dioxide emissions by over 2,000 tonnes and reduce running costs by approximately £400,000; further congratulates the university for the use of photovoltaic and passive ventilation which will be incorporated into the construction of the roof and cladding façade in the new campus building that will house the School of Engineering and Electronics, and encourages other higher education establishments and the Scottish Executive to endorse, encourage and employ the win-win outcome that renewable technologies provide in urban settings. Supported by: Helen Eadie*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Karen Gillon*, Maureen Macmillan*, Bristow Muldoon*, Christine May*, Mike Watson*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
